statement:
Let $L={\mathbb{Q}}(\zeta_m)$ be a cyclotomic extension of
${\mathbb{Q}}$ with $m$ chosen to be minimal and let $\mathcal{O}_L$ be
the ring of integers ($={\mathbb{Z}}(\zeta_m)$), recall that *the
cyclotomic units* are the elements of the form $$\begin{aligned}
\eta=\frac{\zeta^r-1}{\zeta^s-1}\end{aligned}$$ with $r$ and $s$
relatively prime to $m$ (where $\zeta=\zeta_m$). Here we prove that
these elements are indeed algebraic units, i.e.
$\eta \in \mathcal{O}_L^\times$.

The cyclotomic units are algebraic units.

In order to prove the lemma, we will check that both $\eta$ and
$\eta^{-1}$ are algebraic integers, thus $\eta$ is a unit. Notice that
it suffices to prove that $\eta$ is an algebraic integer, because the
rest follows from interchanging the role of $r$ and $s$.

Let $r,s\in {\mathbb{Z}}$ be relatively prime to $m$, thus
$r \mod m, s\mod m$ are units in ${\mathbb{Z}}/m{\mathbb{Z}}$ and we can
find an integer $a$ such that: $$a\cdot s \equiv r \mod m$$ Note also
that it follows that $\zeta^r=\zeta^{as}$. Moreover, using the equality
of polynomials:
$$x^{as}-1=(x^s-1)\cdot(x^{s(a-1)}+x^{s(a-2)}+\ldots+x^s+1)$$ we get:
$$\begin{aligned}
\eta &=& \frac{\zeta^r-1}{\zeta^s-1}=\frac{\zeta^{as}-1}{\zeta^s-1}\\
&=& \frac{(\zeta^s-1)\cdot(\zeta^{s(a-1)}+\zeta^{s(a-2)}+\ldots+\zeta^s+1)}{\zeta^s-1}\\
&=& \zeta^{s(a-1)}+\zeta^{s(a-2)}+\ldots+\zeta^s+1 \in \mathcal{O}_L={\mathbb{Z}}[\zeta]\end{aligned}$$
Hence the result.
names: the cyclotomic units are algebraic units
